More Notes: Historical 50-year droughts may double across 58% of global landmasses in a 1.5◦C warmer world.  (Assuming 2050 as a representative year for mid-century warming)
an additional 9% of world landmasses would be exposed to such catastrophic drought deteriorations relative to 1.5C warming. (Assuming 2050 as a representative year for mid-century warming)
More than 73 countries’ populations(GDP)will be completely affected by increasing drought risks under the 1.5◦C warming (Assuming 2050 as a representative year for mid-century warming)

an extra 0.5◦C warming will further lead to an additional 17 countries suffering from an early unbearable situation (100% GDP exposure). (Assuming 2050 as a representative year for mid-century warming)
